intro: Ourisia poeppigii, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to the Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow floral clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. The flowers, which bloom in spring, are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance.
